reviewText: This plug and play Mpow 4 Port Port USB hub is very sturdy and well built and perfect for the desktop or for a laptop!My favorite thing about is that it is in a one piece unit (nothing to come off it or get lost) and also that is does not require electric power, just plug and go. The desktop or laptop will recgonise the device and it is ready to use right after you plug it in.So easy and simple to use!DESKTOP USES:This is just perfect to add on more USB ports to a desktop computer! What I did was to plug this into on of the front USB ports of my HP Desktop (there are two in the front). This left me with one left one the HP desktop and then four I can use on the hub. So I went from having just two USB ports (on the front of my HP) to five total ports. What I like is that I can also place another Mpow 4 Hub into the HP desktop front if I wanted to and then have eight ports.LAPTOP USES:This is also excellent to use as a travel USB Hub for a laptop to extend the USB ports on the laptop. Because it is so well made and sits flat, this is ideal to take with your laptop.The fact that no power is needed is a plus where I am concerned.This unit was supplied to me for testing and reviewing. And I am very happy to report that I found it to be a superb unit and I am using it now on my HP Desktop.Highly recommend this for desktop or laptop use!
summary: The Mpow 4 Port Portable USB Hub works well on a desktop or a laptop! Very easy to use!

reviewText: it's beautiful. nice build, works well. and good to have a power switch. wish it has higher power adapter cause I connect more than three hd to it some times.
Only had it for a few days now but it's working nicely so far.Pros:- Long cord, 3.3'- Small footprint- USB 3 for a great priceNo cons that I can think of.

I have to say I did not really expect much performance from the AV600 and I got what I expected. I have been skeptical of powerline adapters but figured it was time to give them a try.  I am getting about 10-15Mbps, about the same as my wireless repeater, but somewhat cheaper, and not subject to people walking between them (like the Kitchen).  I was interested to see if I could really get great performance.  No, I am only getting about 10% of my 110 Mbps cable service.  I moved them around to several rooms but it made no difference.  Neither unit is on a UPS or power strip.Setup was super simple, I just plugged them in and they worked.  I moved them around and they immediately started working each and every time. That is good for three stars right there.The AV600 is the newest and I expect the latest and best technology out there. That said, I am not getting anything more than anyone with the basic units at 1/3 the price are getting.  That was a little surprising.Now, I did not try moving them close to see what speeds I could get because, well, what is the point?  I need it on another floor at the other end of the house.

The best PowerLine adapter I've used hands down. My signal is low (orange or red) as I have the main adapter upstairs and the other adapter downstairs. However, this has not affected my ability to stream Blu-ray quality movies over my network so I'm satisfied. I took off one star because this thing never appears to go into sleep mode.
summary: One of the best PowerLine Adapter on the market

reviewText: I used this to create a connection in my Man Cave for my gaming center corner- Gaming PC, PS4, XBOX 360, and XB1 hooked to a big screen.  I realize that this is only connecting one corner of a room to another corner of the same room, but I just plugged them in, hooked them to a GB switch on both ends, and was getting nearly 10MB/s down instantly on Verizon Fios across all devices.  Beyond what I expected- wireless was giving me around 3MB/s with big antennas.  Highly recommend.  Cannot vouch for multi-room setups or across breaker panel loss situations.  For me- perfect.
summary: Plug and Play.  Amazing speeds in the Man Cave.

reviewText: This is a no brainer easy peasy way to setup your home without having to worry about wiring, and messing with complicated wireless schemes!! I tried a similar product made by Asus, and it needed a server program just to let the network operate! That was just unacceptable - and I notice that one died off the products list here at Amazon, and I can see why!! This one doesn't need that nosense; and is MUCH BETTER!The instructions indicate it may be better to plug them together in the same wall socket until they pair first, but we were in hurry and just plugged them in the two locations we already needed them in, and it worked right off the bat!! The throughput is FAST!! I think everyone will be mighty happy with this purchase, and wonder why we didn't go with this in the first place a LONG time ago!I work on other people's computers, so I may not have time to connect using WPA2 or the client may not have wireless at all, so this is a real  savior to my operation. When you rent, you don't really have the option to thread wiring all over the place, and who would want to put up with that trouble anyway?! This option is GREAT!! And really - with the expense of wiring up a house with CAT6 Ethernet, I'm POSITIVE this is way cheaper!!
summary: Absolutely a great time and money saver!!

reviewText: This is my third set of powerline ethernet adapters starting when they first came out. The TP-LINK TL-PA6010KIT blows any I have tried out of the water including a recent try of a well known name brand that I returned. I use my Slingbox extensively both at home away, it has made a very noticeable difference in the quality of the picture. I have been able to use a higher bitrate now, making the most of my broadband connection even though the Slingbox is nowhere near the router. If only all products lived up to what they are supposed to do like this one.
summary: Powerline has cone a long way

reviewText: This is a small dvd player with a big heart. It plays blueray and regular without skipping a beat. I had to replace my sony p.o.s.I bought several years ago. The remote works well, has many features I haven't even discovered yet, and provides a great picture. It is really small, a feature I love. Has a HDMI conection and coaxial to hook up to stereo receiver which offers great sound. I highly recommend especially for the price. Refurbished, who would ever guess, it looks brand new.
summary: Great things come in small packages

reviewText: Much better than earlier Samsung blueray players I have had. Speed is faster, lower ambient noise, internet connection works well.  My only complaint is the lack if features.  Not all video and sound formats play.  For example; the unit claims to support AVI but there are some AVI encoding formats that do not work.  I have also come across some AVI movies where the sound is not supported.  My earlier Samsung blueray player could play the movie, but this new one does not.  I guess they dropped support for some of the older video encoding.  Is you steam home movies beware.

Hey, Samsung doesn't make crap products.  They don't.  I have bought their stuff since the late 70's.  This Blu Ray was almost given away.  This is a win-win for me.  Top product at bargain price.  If you are in the market, and can do the same, jump at the chance.

I came with intentions to find a tablet with decent specs, and behold..... The Astro Queo.I have had a few tablets both Google play approved and unapproved, but this is by far the tablet that makes like away from google not a huge deal. 1mobile market, amazon app market, in addition to others make up for it.I find 1 gig of ram is a decent standard which is a specification that applies across the board, so remember 1 gig or greater ram.the in device 8sd card is a good way to start off.What had me going oh yes was the male micro usb to female usb cord it came with allowing expansion for mouse/keyboard and storage. Currently i have tested a 1TB portable hard drive and it works perfectly, even better an additional micro-SD card to which i personally use a 64GB micro-SD.Things you will consider that i did not find necessary but may give a second guess.The tablet is not bluetooth capable stand-alonewith Google approval - no Google play, Google+, or games that rely on Google services.

What amazes me the most about this tablet is the battery life. It said 6 hrs but I have left it on 2-3 days at a time using it randomly and as an example, right now it is still at 76% after almost 48 hrs. I also use a work supplied Samsung Galaxy 3 and it has nowhere near the battery life of this one.Now the bad, it has no access to the Google Play Store and you can't install it either. I have researched it and it seems to be a licensing issue. The included apps store is anemic at best. With that said, I use it to play Words, occasionally to stream Netflix, do Facebook or Gmail while watching movies and it does all that quite well. The lack of Bluetooth capability was shocking but not a deal killer. Also, I can't access it via USB cable the way I have been able to with every other tablet I have owned.Often I have to tap a button on the screen 10 - 15 times before it works. No idea why. But that's not a constant issue so no biggie. The case itself is very plasticy feeling and nowhere near as 'solid' as my Samsung, but then again the Samsung is a $300+ tablet.Would I buy it again knowing what I know now? Yeah, probably. You can't get a 9 inch 1.5 ghz dual core with a gig of DDR3 ram for that price anywhere else that I have seen. I would recommend it as a second or light duty tablet for home use ONLY. It's lack of Bluetooth and USB connectivity make it unsuitable for the workplace.

I found this tablet to work perfect.  No problem connecting to my wireless internet and could get most of the apps I need.  The only thing I wish it had was google play because I need it for one of my movie apps.  If it had this app would have given it a 5 star.  A plus in ordering this tablet was it was Made in the USA. Also, manual needs to be in larger size letter.  You need a magnifier to read it.

I am a huge fan of Samsung and I was going to order the BD-F5900 model but when I went to the page a newer model BD-H5900 was offered so I thought it was logical to go that route. The newer model is not updated in the Amazon system and will not be able to give you Amazon Instant video services as of yet.I also checked with Samsung's website and the newer Model is not even on there. Sadly I had to order the older model and Liz at customer service took care of it. Hopefully this problem will be fixed soon and I just wanted you all to know so you did not have to go through the same problem
Very slim and low profile. Has all the needed features. Works well with Samsung TV.
summary: Nice, compact design with key functionalities built-in.

reviewText: PISSED.I'm on my 3rd copy of this lens. Using center points on both my 5d3 and 6d it's accurate, but if you use any outer points on either it results in front focusing. Before I get grilled, in terms of the 5d3 I use only cross type outer points, not the last single orientation row, though I have additionally tried those as well, and they too yield the same results.  AFMA can't fix it because the center and out point calibration is off. It is not my cameras as they work perfectly with all my other lenses, and I have tested my friend's sigma 50 art on both of my cameras and it does not have this issue and focuses perfectly at all points on both cameras. I don't know if I'm just extremely unlucky, or what because I have not heard anybody else make this observation with theirs. Sigma: how many of these do I have to buy before I end up with a copy without focus problems? The optics are stunning and I don't want to give up on it, but I'm getting really tired of buying and returning, and I'm sure the dealers are not enjoying the process either.*****UPDATEI spent two weeks almost waiting for sigma to repair this lens, only to receive a phone call saying they do not have the parts necessary, that it would take 4-6 weeks at the earliest before they can get the parts, and that I should return the lens to the dealer. Now I'm cutting it extremely close to the return date limit. How can you put products on the market without having the parts to repair them? My rating has changed to two stars. The lens itself would be a 5 if I had received a perfectly functioning copy, but because I got a lemon, and waited two weeks to hear the bad news from Sigma's service center, the lens gets a two- because part of buying a product is the service and support you receive from the company that makes it. Now even if I manage to return the lens on time, there aren't any in stock to rebuy and the price has since gone up by $100.Not happy.*******The optics are second to none. Very sharp, the colors and contrast are amazing, and the flare resistance is incredible. However, my copy is having focusing problems. On my 5d mark iii, the center points work just fine most of the time, but the outer points result in a heavy front focusing. If you AFMA the outer points (though even +20 isn't quite enough), it throws the center points off, so it's not a user fixable issue. On my other camera, a 6d, some times it doesn't seem to need AFMA, other times +8 seems to make it better, some times that same +8 seems to make it worse, etc. However, if I use this lens on my 6d in SERVO focusing, I've had pretty good results with all focus points. Strange, but I need it to work consistently in all focusing modes, and on both cameras! I have done tripod mounted controlled tests with both cameras so no, it's not user error (before somebody tries to lecture me by restating a bunch of stuff they read online somewhere).I am sending this lens to sigma, I will report back when I receive it. I have not heard of others with issues yet, but there aren't many of these out. I also own a sigma 35mm 1.4 art lens and it works great on both of my cameras with all focus points, as do the rest of my lenses.

I reserved a week ahead and got mine from a store on 4.25.14. The lens is extremely sharp. Sharper than my Canon lenses. Chroma is very very unnoticeable and saturation is great. Very slight aberration. Flare is well controlled. The focus is a lot slower compared to my Canon lenses when shooting darkly lit subject. Some of my shots came out fuzzy. It is okay on a normal lighting situation. This lens is very heavy but it balances well with my 6D. Oh the bokeh is very rough at close distance and very wide opening. But I am in love with the sharpness. It is well built.  Not cheap looking.  I hope the focus ring stays taut even after years of use.  4.5 Stars only for me. Enjoy your lens folks.

I am a professional wedding photographer shooting with a 5Dmkiii and 6D. I have owned all three of Canon's current 50mm lenses. This lens is head and shoulders above them all. After I micro adjusted the lens, the focus was spot on. It is razor sharp. Even at f1.4 it is much sharper even then my 135L @f2. The color and contrast at f1.4 are perfect. No purple haze or CA like I experienced with the 50 f1.2. Well done Sigma.
Excellent like the other Sigma Art which I already have (35 and 24-105). Super sharp and this lens has the Sigma Art personality (high collors and contast).
summary: Excellent like the other Sigma Art!!!

reviewText: Best 50mm I have ever used.

My 15 month old Lenovo Thinkpad Twist got a bad case of terminal BSOD. I will be working to repair, but needed an IMMEDIATE solution - a local store was offering this one at about 2/3 the price here on Amazon as a special deal, and I grabbed it.Since it is local, I did not have the "battery problem" some have experienced on other Toshiba Satellites from Amazon. I was willing to take the risk knowing the local store would stand behind the sale. I tested all of the issues others have reported (including the DVD reader - no problems) it works seamlessly.It is about 2 pounds heavier than my other computer (full weight is 5.4 pounds), but that is because it is LARGER than the other one. I love the nice bright screen, and am enjoying being able to read "stuff" better than a smaller screen. Unlike some, I use my laptop at home most of the time, and 2 pounds isn't a big deal.My last one was an ultra - I love having this one where I can replace the battery myself and have a spare on hand for long trips. I really do love having the Superdrive, meaning I can watch a DVD, play a CD, import songs, burn CDs. You don't realize how often you want these features until you have a computer without it.It responds slightly more slowly than the Lenovo I had, but well within tolerable allowances. I notice it most on loading internet pages. But slightly means just a tiny bit. It takes about four seconds longer to start up following a restart.It has a full keyboard, with a 10-key pad on the right. The keyboard is "flat" without raised keys, but have a slightly raised point on the J and F keys making it easy to find your spot.The touchpad (I use a trackball because of carpal tunnel) is configured the way I prefer, with the two buttons on the bottom.I used the memory card reader to transfer some files (some by Drop Box) and it read the card rapidly and transferred the files quickly. I am happy with that.With three USB ports, I can easily keep my trackball at hand and yet charge my iPhone if I want, and still have room to pop in a flash drive. Only one of the USB ports is 3.0, and you can change the setting to make it into a 2.0 if you want to save battery time.The screen is bright, and I am very happy with it. It is NOT touchscreen - something I am happy about. A touchscreen also is an energy hog, and I seldom used mine. Glad to go back to simple.NOTE - if you haven't used Windows 8, you will have a hard time adjusting, but that isn't the computer's fault. :-) This one comes pre-installed with 8.1 which I had already wanted. It adds functionality to Windows 8, although it doesn't compensate for everything that is a problem. You do NOT need a touchscreen to run Windows 8. I have an iPad and iPhone and am very used to touch, but didn't need it on Windows 8.While I purchased it as an "emergency" fill in, I will likely keep it as my primary laptop ... it is that good. I took off the star because I felt it was a tiny bit slower, and because I feel documentation could have been better for new users. However as an "older user" of Windows 8, everything installed seamlessly for me.

For what it is, it's a great item. First off, when I was offered to review this item I thought it was going to be one of those cheap Chinese hidden camera and I have to say I was very wrong. This thing can do it all and it can fit in your pocket! This is definitely one of the items you need in your tech-bag if you travel.EDIT: It helps if you read the instructions! The headphones double as a antenna for the FM Radio and works great. ( Just a heads up for anyone that might be having trouble with the fm radio )
summary: For what it is, It's fantastic!

reviewText: Love this Great Tablet!  This is one fantastic tablet.You will have to download all the Windows 8 updates before it will download a copy of Windows 8.1.  This in fact took 2 days because it would get partially thru the update, run into a problem, which in turn would cause the update to be rolled back and finally restart the update process all over again.  It got frustrating but finally it did successfully update.  Then it finally downloaded the Windows 8.1.I now have a powerful computer that is equal to any desktop and it works beautifully,  I love it!  I love it! and I LOVE IT!This is one great little computer.  Worth every penny and the frustrating 2 days to finally get  my hands on it.Buy it because it i worth owning.
Excellent in every way. I couldn't be happier.

I purchased a large and expensive Samsung LED TV from Amazon. Amazon was great. Fast and easy delivery. Unfortunately after 10 months, the TV stopped functioning at all. It made a clicking sound when the power button was depressed, but no image or sound. Fortunately, it was still under warranty. Samsung  sent out a local repairman who fixed the TV. He mentioned it would have cost $1000 for the repair (replacing 2 circuit boards) if I was paying for it. It took him <3 minutes to switch the boards. The TV worked again. Now 2 years later - same problem. I called Samsung. They very politely told me that I was screwed. They would not fix the TV, provide the parts or even a provide discount on the repair or parts despite the fact that it was the same problem the TV experienced 2 years earlier. With further investigation online, I learned that this is a very common problem for Samsung TVs.  They produce a power supply board that fails easily.  Beware - if you do not want a very expensive paperweight after 3 years’ time, look at another manufacturer for your next TV.

A lightning strike ate several TVs in my house so I had to get a replacement for my living room. This 65" Samsung is outstanding. It has a great picture, awesome apps and even provides us with some broadcast TV when needed. Great purchase.

The picture is amazing even for non 4k content.  Setup is easy and the IR blaster for the cable box works great.  I have viewed Netflix 4K content but do not see a dramatic difference between that and the unconverted HD content.  The Smart Hub software keeps your apps up to date without much effort.  The pixels are indistinguishable even up close and the tv is incredibly thin and light weight.  Overall, very satisfied!con:The ethernet connection and the IR blaster connections are not off-set which means they will stick straight out the back which might make it difficult for a shallow wall mount

I was planning on purchasing this set from Amazon today but first thought I would see it in person at a local box store. Yes the color was amazing, I loved the almost 3D depth perception and was truly impressed with the up scaling of non 4K material. Not sure if it was the curved screen or advanced technology that seemed to give this set a brilliance less evident on other 4K flat screen TV's on view. But then the screen turned to a full black background and there it was.... any light in the room was reflected on the screen causing a slight cast of an almost rainbow effect running across the set horizontally. At first I figured it wouldn't be an issue because how often does one view a totally black screen? But then I noticed reoccurring light reflections regardless of the screen content. I asked the salesman about it and he said all the new 2014 Samsung models had a reflection problem compared to the 2013 and earlier models. In fact he beamed a flashlight on other sets and all you saw was the white pin light reflected from the bulb. He then shined it on this model and besides the white bulb reflection you now saw three rings of rainbow colors encircling the pin light. Not good. Unfortunately Samsung wanted the set displayed at the entry way of the TV/Audio department where there was an abundance of store lights reflecting off it. Had it been displayed in a darker area I doubt I would have been as aware of its flaw. However I am concerned about what it will look like in my living room on a sunny day. Can anyone who owns the UN65HU9000 model comment on its performance in a well lit room? Thanks.UPDATE:Spoke to a rep at Crutchfield and he said both he and fellow reps instantly noticed the glare/reflection problem upon first viewing this model. Also spoke with Samsung only to be told there were no reports of any consumer problems with the glare issue. I was sorry to hear that since I had hoped their next generation might have corrected the problem. It's definitely a deal breaker for me.
summary: I'm truly surprised the glare issue hasn't been addressed by anyone.

reviewText: I'm a sleeve guy because I don't like anything on my tablet when I'm using it.This sleeve fits nice and will protect the tablet when not in use or when we're on a trip.The material is like an old leather chair your grandparents use to have.  I think that's intentional.....maybe the idea is to make it retro.  I've had sleeves with materials that look more modern, and I like those a little better.  But this is nice too.  Looks just fine sitting on the coffee table.Can't beat it for the price.UPDATE:  The first case had a flaw on one side that way overdid the worn look.  I emailed them a picture and they immediately sent me a replacement.  Got the replacement today and it's much better than the first one.  I'm upgrading my rating to 5 stars.  Also rated the vendor 5 starts on the marketplace.  They are first class.
Revised the review after contacting the seller.Product only fit for the surface itself without the type cover.
summary: fits only the surface without the type cover

reviewText: The manufacturer promptly answered my question and says this would work with the new Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 inch.  It fit perfectly.  This case looks great. For people like me that don't always need to prop their tablet up on something,  this case is perfect.  It doesn't look trashy at all.I prefer to hold the tablet alone without a case.  This sleeve comes on and off easily. The sleeve would stick a bit right when I put it in the first couple times.  The first night, I left my tablet in it all night. After a while of carrying it around,  the sleeve forms to the shape of the tablet, and my tablet shoes in and out easily now.This sleeve seems like it offers great protection from scratches and bumps while in a bag or backpack.  If you drop your tablet on the ground and it hits on the open side of the sleeve,  then your tablet will be banged up pretty good.  I would highly recommend this sleeve, even if you already own some other type of case.
summary: Works perfectly with the Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5!

reviewText: wowzers is all I can say.  Replaced a PNY 560Ti - Gave me an extra 1GB for video, it is smaller in size, and best of all, no dang power cables are needed to power it up (takes it from the slot - minimum power supply needed is 300w. but if you are running an i7 with 2 or 3 hard drives and a DVD burner with 8 or more GB of ram, you best be running a power supply a little bit larger :) .It is a video card, finally done right. Good job Nvidia.
Takes up a lot less space and runs much cooler than the 680 I was using. I am not a gamer so can not rate it with game performance.
I replaced by EVGA 460 SE with this card and I love it. Works great and 2x as fast as my old vid card.

reviewerName: FatedCb "Every one of us has a purpose here."

reviewText: I bought this for my new HTPC build.  I love this!!!  Best graphics card bang for the buck!Pros:FastStable2GB GDDR5QuietRuns coolShorter length for tighter buildsEVGA's fantastic warranty and serviceCons:None

After many years of being a console gamer, I purchased a prebuilt gaming PC in 2013 for my 18th birthday. The only bottleneck in its performance was the GPU, an Nvidia GT610. Flash forward to early 2014. I too read all the technology articles about this card, calling it an Xbox killer, PS4 slasher, all of that. "Plays Titanfall better than Xbox One at 1080p" was a frequent comment made by journalists referring to this card. I let the hype build in me until I finally decided to put my tax return towards this card. Is it as good as you'd think? Let's discuss pros and cons.PROS:-Price point. $150 is super cheap for this level performance, though I imagine with Bitcoin miners becoming more common, and with more people finding out about this card, the price will rise. (I paid around $140 for mine.) I was happier than a kid on Christmas in 1996 when I finally got it, and could see what it could do.-Graphics capabilities. This card WILL run just about everything on high/ultra settings at 1080p with minimal optimization and minimal lag. Battlefield 3/4 on Ultra at 1080p, clocked it at 35-55fps. Similar performance from Metro 2033/Last Light on High. Skyrim maxed out at just under 60fps. It does it all and with such ease.-Runs cool/low power consumption. I have never seen this card heat up above 35-40C. My case fans seem to run quieter as well, since the large fan on this card effectively disperses heat and helps keep parts cool. The card itself only draws 60w of power which is very convenient, and only has a minimum power supply wattage requirement of 300w, which, in this day and age, likely comes with a very modest store bought desktop, if that.-Not noisy. I don't know what other reviewers are talking about... this card has the quietest fan out of my whole rig. My old graphics card (Nvidia GT610) was exponentially louder. The fan is large and actually takes up most of the card. You can control the speed of the fan in percentages, using the included software (discussed below.)-Maxwell architecture. Maxwell is Nvidia's newest card architecture, which allows the card to run 2x more efficiently than last generation's Kepler architecture, with less than half of the power consumption. This is the first card available with that architecture and I imagine many more cards will adopt it in the future, until the next generation of Nvidia cards comes out (with something even better :P)-Ease of installation/use. The card doesn't run on external power, which is one of the main reasons I bought it. Simply take out your old card, pop the new one into the PCI-Express slot, and hook it up to your monitor. You're all ready to go. Took me less than 5 minutes to set up the new card. Pop it in, boot up your computer, install the drivers and boom. Prepare yourself for glorious gaming.-Nvidia Shadowplay support. The 700 family of Nvidia's GPUs all support Nvidia Shadowplay, which is currently in beta. Shadowplay is a video recording software, similar to Fraps or DXTory, but unlike those programs which record video from the CPU, lowering framerates and clogging up hard drives with large file sizes, Shadowplay records video from your GPU itself directly, at 1080p (with an option for other resolutions like 240/480/720/in-game,) without an FPS counter or any watermarks, and at incredibly small file sizes! This is a huge thing for gamers, especially those who like to record themselves.-Ease of overclocking. The card itself ships with EVGA's proprietary software, "EVGA Precision X." It's a powerful program that allows you to boost the performance of your card and tweak just about every feature. It's very useful and helps you to overclock your card (though the SuperClock edition of the 750ti has a higher base block, which is why I bought it.)CONS:-None. Owned the card for a little over a week now with no problems. It not only lived up to all of my expectations but totally surpassed them, blowing them away into the dust. This card will do it all, and with no problems. It represents a phenomenal value in performance graphics cards. For the PC gamer on a budget, I would recommend this card as it will hold its value and performance for the years to come. If you want all the horsepower like the big boys, but don't want to spend a fortune on a racecar, this card is what you're looking for.Kudos to Nvidia for their revolutionary, exceptional card, and as always, EVGA delivers a consistent, high quality OEM card with the modern PC gamer in mind. Another satisfied customer.MY RIG (For those interested):-Windows 7 Home Premium Edition 64 Bit SP1-1TB HDD-Gigabyte GA-78LMT-S2 motherboard-AMD FX4100 quad-core CPU @4.4gHz-8gb DDR3 RAM-Nvidia GeForce GTX750TI 2GB VRAM GPU

This is the first card in Nvidia's new "Maxwell" architecture that would be the Geforce 8-series.  I think this is their first spin with the current process, and performance-wise fits into the 7-series right at the number the card has.  I think with the shrink we will see a similar (and probably a little faster) version of this card as the 850.  The level of performance is good, but in terms of the power and heat...it's among the best out there.It is very low power, but the performance is good enough for 1080p at a good frame rate with today's games.  I got this card for my Linux box, and with the 331.49 Linux 64-bit driver the card is detected correctly, and works just great, even in demanding games like Metro Last Light; at 1920*1200 the frame rate was smooth with nearly maximum settings (for Linux at least).  Driver support is of course very new (it wasn't correctly detected in the 331.20 set) so performance could very well improve even more.  So, basically even though you need Windows according to the box, the card works just fine in 64-bit Linux (both Ubuntu 12.04 and 13.10).The card itself is very small and light.  It's not really very loud either.  There is no 6-pin connector; it draws all power through the slot.  Some cards are sold with that connector, but I think even with a high overclock, you may not even need it.  As to overclocking, I use it in Linux so I can't tell you that...but this is the superclocked version so it will run at over 1200Mhz boosted easily, as indicated in the specifications.
summary: Very happy with it so far.  Runs cool, low power, with good performance, works in Linux

reviewText: This is the best graphics card for the money out there.  This will get you into Skyrim and Call of Duty with max settings no problem.

I have had this for a couple of months, now, and I figured I'd get around to writing a review.Bottom line: I like it.  It does what it does, and it does it pretty well.The rubbery feel works well.  When closed up, it carries well, and has just enough texture and friction to be firm and have a "good grip" feel, but not be annoying.  The flap seems to protect the screen adequately enough, and while I was concerned about the magnet being a problem, it doesn't seem to be an issue at all.When carrying the tablet with the cover open, like in a meeting or class and you're taking notes, the cover feels lose when it is fully open.  Its actually quite uncomfortable.  What I notice I do is that I fold back the first portion of the flap, and that tightens things up nicely, and gives my fingers something quite handy to grip with, once again giving me the "I have a good grip" feel that it has when its closed.  Until I figured that out, though... I was highly annoyed.  =]The stand aspect of the cover is nice.  It holds the device upright quite firmly. I put a bluetooth keyboard in front, and type away, and it works like a charm.  I also can flip up just the first flap, and then its largely laying down, but at an angle... that lets me use the onscreen keyboard and the pen with relative comfort, while still tilting the tablet toward me... I actually do that the most as far as standing it up goes.  The full upright position is very handy for watching movies, and skyping and stuff.The sides of the device are well protected, and the notches are more than adequate to provide access to the various ports and buttons and whatnot.  When the flap is flipped back behind, you can access the SD Card without removing the device from the cover, but with it closed, it is well protected from popping out.  (I had a tablet do that once to me, which is why I bring it up)I had some concern when I first put it on about heat, but it seems to transfer heat just fine, and it has not been an issue at all.In short, I like it.  Its hard to get excited about a cover, because if they do what they do well, then you don't really think about them much.  I sort of think if it as part of my tablet... as if it came that way.I'm very happy with it, and it seems to be holding up very well - I use this thing literally every day, for most of the day, and I carry my device everywhere.  I would recommend this cover to anyone buying the ASUS VivoTab Note 8.
summary: I like it. It does what it does

reviewText: Holes and notches match the buttons/sockets on my Asus slate.  Magnet cover clicks securely. Cover doesnt add a lot of weight/bulk to the slate.  Felt on the inside of the case keeps it from scratching the back of the slate, I also keep extra micro sim cards and a cleaning cloth back there.  Great protection for the Asus.

This is a really clever design, better than the VersaSleeve for the Asus (which I also have.) To use the Asus ViveoTab Note 8 with the VersaSleeve, you have to take the tablet out of the sleeve. With this, you can use it with the case opened, and prop if up for viewing without removing it. And there are no magnets to interfere with the Wacon pen. The elastic band closure is very cleverly designed and easy to flip over to hold the case closed.What keeps it from giving it five stars is that the build quality is less than perfect. reviewText: This is a well-constructed and comfortable small bag.  Traditional small bags with a shoulder strap tend to slide of the shoulder.  This bag slings like a backpack.  It is comfortable and functional and keeps the equipment inside protected.  Many reviewers have complained about the limitations in size, but if you want to take all your equipment, use a large backpack.  However, for the many times you want to take your camera and maybe an additional lens, this bag gets the job done safely and comfortably.  Recommended.

For the most part, this camera bag is well designed and well thought out. It's not only compact but its ergonomics is such that it will allow you very quick and easy access to your camera. This camera bag definitely has a few very nifty features that I love. I do, however, have a couple of complaints:1) The compartments can't be configured to hold a larger lens. For example, it won't hold my Canon EF 100-400mm f/5.6 lens (even with the lens hood off). This camera bag may not be well suited for bird and wildlife photographers and portrait photographers who use a bigger portrait lens such as the Canon EF 70-200mm f/2.8. Still, the bag is very practical for landscape photography -- and that's what I'll be using this bag primarily for.2) Tripods (save for the ultra compact and lightweight tripods like thisSlik Sprint Mini II Tripod) cannot be securely strapped onto the side. The paltry single tripod strap on the side of the camera bag gives larger tripods plenty of wiggle room and that's definitely not something you want while you're on the go.In all other respects, I'd have to say Case Logic has done an incredible job in making this camera bag very, very user friendly:= ErgonomicsThe camera bag has strategically placed handle bars that allow you to steady the camera bag with one hand while the other hand is able to quickly zip or unzip a compartment. The operation of the zippers to all compartments is very, very smooth. All zippers have these very distinctive zipper pulls that make reaching for a zipper to zip or unzip a compartment BY FEEL uncannily quick and effortless.= CompactnessThe camera bag measures 9" x 6" x 14" (L x W x H). Its compact size is ideal for the photography who doesn't want to be bogged down by clunky and unwieldy camera equipment while on the go. Wildlife and landscape photographers and photographers who want to travel light will appreciate the mobility this camera bag affords them over traditional camera bags.= ProtectivenessThe camera bag is well-padded all around to protect your camera and lenses from some bumps, or even a short drop.= CompartmentsNow, let talk compartments:- Main (Side) CompartmentThe main compartment will hold a full size DSLR (e.g. Canon 5D Mark III) with a larger walk-around lens (e.g. Canon EF 24-70mm f/2.8) plus one or two smaller lenses.- Top CompartmentThe top compartment will hold batteries, cleaning implements (lens pen, lens blowers, microfiber cloth, etc), and a few other odds and ends. Within the this compartment is a zippered compartment for your filters and memory cards,- Back CompartmentThe back compartment is big enough for a good-sized tablet (possibly a smaller notebook). It measures 8" x 11".- Tripod CompartmentThe tripod strap will securely hold an ultra compact and lightweight tripod.= RainflyThe camera bag comes with a rainfly stowed on the bottom of the unit will keep your camera equipment dry in the event of rain.---As an avid hiker and photographer, I will be using this camera bag for taking my equipment with me while I'm on shorter (~10-mile or less) hikes. I had never been a fan of the single should sling camera bags, but after using this Case Logic bag, I have become a convert!The Verdict: If you're looking for a compact camera bag that will hold a bigger camera lens, this camera bag will unfortunately not fit the bill. However, if you have no need to bring along a bigger camera lens and you use an ultra compact tripod, I think you'll be very happy with this camera bag.
summary: Allows Quick And Easy Access To Your DSLR But Won't Hold A Bigger Telephoto Lens And Sloppy Tripod Strap

reviewText: DSH-102 holds a DSLR camera and one lens. To me, the holster could have been much smaller/less bulky and still hold the 1 camera and lens. This is one of the coolest products I have seen. This can take any AUX speaker and give them Bluetooth capabilities. The Bluetooth Music Adapter is a USB rechareable device and has two buttons that allow you to skip or replay a song.When you plug in your AUX speakers to the Bluetooth Music Adapter, press and hold down the middle button until it turns on and enters discovery mode. Using your Bluetooth enabled device connect/pair to the IBT-03 device name. After you are connected, you can play music from any source and the speakers with the Bluetooth Music Adapter connected will play the music.I used this device on my dancing water speakers that are not Bluetooth. I simply connected the Bluetooth Music Adapter to the speakers with an AUX cable, connected to the Bluetooth with my smartphone, and after I was connected, I could play music from my phone or Internet Radio and they worked perfectly!

reviewText: I've had a variety of generations of Samsung monitors alternating between them and Dell.  This latest from Samsung is an excellent 27" model that is so thin and light with such a small bezel that compared to its immediate predecessors looks like it's actually smaller even though it was a couple inches larger diagonally.I had been trying to use a recent 32” Samsung LED TV as a monitor but ultimately that was a bit tough on the eyes with the 1080P resolution that close on a monitor/TV that large.  So I hunted around and when I saw these new monitors from Samsung at the incredible intro price of 279 I wanted to jump on it, the pricing seems to alternate every few months between the 279 and 329.These are Samsung’s PLS panel tech, their take on IPS so the color reproduction and viewing angles are much better than the cheaper TFTs.  The screen is matte though the bezel is a bit glossy.I was very pleased w/ the default color temperature and saturation, it was not too ‘cool’ as some prior ones had been and additionally there were no dead pixels, woo hoo.  I’ve got the brightness still set to 100 although I’ve seen some folks have turned that down.So far no noticeably bad ghosting when gaming.  I do classic arcade/computer emulation with MAME and MESS and vertical arcade games will have pillarboxes on the sides and these are nice and black.  In a darkened room there is a slight backlight bleed but nothing too onerous;  it’s not an OLED.Overall, very pleased and would highly recommend it esp. at the 279 price point.  I have just ordered a second one.
summary: Excellent Samsung monitor, esp.  for the price.

reviewText: Overall it's a nice wide monitor with great clarity. Hoever, if I wanted it nitpick the only thing I would have to criticize is, the bleeding on the right side of the monitor. It's not extremely noticeable but if you scrutinize it's there. I like this monitor a lot, I would buy two if I was a hard core gamer.

This is a great monitor.  I love the resolution.  The only problem I have with it is that they didn't put much quality into the stand.  Even the slightest vibration makes the monitor do a bobble head like shake which can get quite annoying.  It also doesn't appear to have standard mounts, so using a third party stand for multiple monitors looks like a no go.

reviewText: I bought this so I didn't have to rent a modem/router from xfinity.  This is compatible and was VERY easy to set up.  I totally recommend it!

reviewText: I had a hard time finding anything on Netgear's site about this, the product to search for isn't the N300, it is the c3000. I have better luck searching on Google than the manufacturer's website. I was looking for a firmware update to resolve the slower download speeds which some others have complained of. I honestly have my main systems hardwired for speed. The wireless is for portable devices where blazing speed isn't crucial.Also, this is a single band radio, giving "up to" 300mbps on the 2.4ghz band. The 5ghz frequency  is preferred as there is much less chatter on this frequency. There are lots of other shared items in the 2.4ghz realm. The modem supports 8 download and 4 upload channels.Parental controls are quick and painless to setup, just like the unit itself.
